content: The Act titled "Principal Residence Tax Exclusion Act of 1996" provides an exemption from tax for gain on the sale of a principal residence for individuals aged 55 and above, as outlined in Section 121 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Principal Residence Tax Exclusion Act of 1996 allows individuals aged 55 and above to exclude gain from the sale of their principal residence from gross income, with limitations on the amount excluded and frequency of use.
